intro: Merostachys leptophylla, commonly known as the slender-leaf grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the grass family (Poaceae). It is native to the eastern United States, particularly found in moist, open habitats such as woodlands and wetlands. The plant has slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, spike-like inflorescence consists of numerous tiny flowers arranged in clusters. Merostachys leptophylla is typically found in shaded to partially sunny environments and is adapted to thrive in humid conditions.
